I don't anything about Keith site I'm speaking on somone who does this alwa=
ys...I'm not attacking you,however I am a aggressive women if I come across=
 that way its' because of the passion I have on the subject...Frank is righ=
t you DON"T want to see..so more then likely you won't

--- On Sun, 12/19/1=
0, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:


From: Tim Woolworth <tjwo=
olworth@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ok so im getting stuff on the=
 spectergram
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Sunday, December 19, 2010, 8=
:31 AM


=C2=A0 



Relax Ursula.


I too have been aware of this at Keith'=
s site for long, long time, but like I said in the last post, I am very new=
 to this as in doing it on my own computer. =C2=A0Just like you. =C2=A0So d=
on't act like you know what I do and do not know, thank you very much. =C2=
=A0


I am not attacking you so back the hell off. =C2=A0I made it clear th=
at this was for my own own edification, for me to accept my own images.=C2=
=A0=C2=A0


The image I ever so briefly mentioned the one posted that had s=
everal "Faces" or pieces thereof that were circled. =C2=A0As for your image=
 of the man peeking out, I saw nothing there. =C2=A0Period. =C2=A0=C2=A0Did=
 I say previously what I thought about the quality of the images in that ph=
oto? =C2=A0No. =C2=A0I politely kept it to myself because I do not like to =
differ with people or to deflate hot air balloons. =C2=A0But there you have=
 it, that is what I saw. =C2=A0And to my knowledge, that is the only time I=
 have described what I have seen thus far in your images other than mention=
ing the word "eyebrows." =C2=A0In the one that had many circles, I saw one =
that looked like a set of lips and a chin and the rest I personally thought=
 was matrixing. =C2=A0Once again, did I saw this? =C2=A0No. =C2=A0But you a=
sked for it so there it is.


The whole point of my post, had you read it w=
ith a clear head. =C2=A0It was all about my own edification, that I, and I =
alone, need to keep plugging in files before I, and I alone, make a judgeme=
nt about MY images and whether they are real or not based upon the images t=
hey provide in contrast to the bulk of other files. =C2=A0If you simply com=
pare your one image with the many circles to the youtube file, I suspect I =
am correct in saying that faces occur with much more rarity than your circl=
e file and that they can appear fully formed. =C2=A0Once again, I suspect, =
only, and I will only be able to tell after time. =C2=A0Sample size is ever=
ything, and I thought I made that abundantly clear. =C2=A0The post was simp=
ly about my process of learning rather than running out and saying look wha=
t I found when I simply don't know what has been found yet because it is th=
e first time I have played with the controls rather than seeing the end sna=
pshots on another persons website. =C2=A0


Why do you always jump on the d=
efensive and attack every one who does not fall in line with you? =C2=A0Not=
 everything has to be fight or flight, Ursula, and not every bridge has to =
be burned so thoroughly to the ground. =C2=A0This is not an attack on you o=
r results, reread the post, and this time thinking a little more clearly ab=
out what is written on the page and not your own emotional backlash constru=
ing things in the posted text that are simply not there. =C2=A0Had you done=
 this, you would have seen the point of my post was not an attack on you, i=
n ANY way. =C2=A0 =C2=A0


Tim

--- On Sat, 12/18/10, Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...> wrot=
e:


From: Tim Woolworth <tjwoolworth@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re:=
 ok so im getting stuff on the spectergram
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date=
: Saturday, December 18, 2010, 4:57 PM


=C2=A0 

No, I don't think I am be=
ing too critical, but I may have expectations that are a little too high. =
=C2=A0I want to take my time with this. =C2=A0For my own understanding, I n=
eed to have a large sample size so I know not only what to expect to see, b=
ut what to look for. =C2=A0I have seen ITC snapshots from programs like thi=
s that offer full faces. =C2=A0I would be more inclined to believe in such =
an image as opposed to, lets say. two dark lines that may or may not be eye=
brows. 


Even in your example of the towel, you get half a face. =C2=A0If =
you have half a face (on the vertical plane, not the horizontal) you can ex=
trapolate out what the entire face would look like. =C2=A0This is something=
 I would like to get myself and I would consider that evidence if it showed=
 up in one of these programs. =C2=A0But, if you have something that looks l=
ike a forehead and that is all there is, then it could also look like a roc=
k or some other such object.


I am certainly hoping for results worked int=
o box sessions. =C2=A0Directing a session with intent, like saying "I am go=
ing to examine the sound waves of this communication in hopes of seeing you=
r face. =C2=A0Is it possible you can show your face to me now through sound=
? " is what I am after. =C2=A0If a positive hit like this happens, then I w=
ill be jumping for joy. =C2=A0Another good example would be a name, lets sa=
y Tom, that occurs. =C2=A0If you get a positive affirmation that the name y=
ou heard is present, then you try the same technique only you address Tom b=
y name and get a face, that would be even better.


But, as it stands now, =
the faces as they appear are random at best. =C2=A0I would be more inclined=
 to believe that when these faces do occur , they are going to occur with a=
 lesser frequency than multiple images in a few seconds of audio like Ursul=
a's example. =C2=A0If this where the case, there would be dozens, and possi=
bly hundreds, of faces during a ten minute session and I just don't think t=
hat is possible. =C2=A0This is why I need to look at several samples to fin=
d out if this is the case or not. =C2=A0If these partialized faces occur in=
 multiples all the time, I would be more apt to discount it. =C2=A0But, if =
they are a rarity affixed to only a few clips out of dozens, I would be mor=
e inclined to believe in them. =C2=A0Sample size is everything. =C2=A0It is=
 like listening to GBC. =C2=A0If you have never done a session before, you =
would be inclined to believe every stray radio signal is a communication. =
=C2=A0Only by continued practice (expanding your sample size) can you start=
 to
 rule out stray radio with any degree of accuracy. =C2=A0


On the othe=
r hand, I am very new to this and I could certainly be wrong. =C2=A0I will =
continue to plug sound into the programs and hope for the best. =C2=A0


I =
really want this to work. =C2=A0As you have probably experienced, when they=
 want you to hear something or know something, they make it very obvious wh=
ile communicating. =C2=A0I am hoping they apply this same rigor to this new=
 format to show us that they are there. =C2=A0If they can, then the world o=
f video and audio ITC will merge in one source and then the skeptics be dam=
ned!


Tim


On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 2:24 PM, Frank Sumption <purplealiengi=
rl@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 




=C2=A0I think it's unrealistic to expect=
 every file to have faces and images. These faces are often just portions, =
eyes and lips, some have eye brows. Like all of this, not done for proof, i=
t's for emotional impact.=C2=A0 I have this woman that shows up in towels, =
always just half the face. Perahps you are being too critical? As with all =
spirit messages, it's what it means to the experiencer that matters. Expect=
ing full faces is like expecting the kings english and proper grammer in al=
l EVPs. 
=C2=A0
F-S





On Sat, Dec 18, 2010 at 3:07 AM, Tim Woolworth <tj=
woolworth@...> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I saw a couple which could be cons=
trued as images in the one series you had from SEA, but nothing that knocke=
d me over the head yet. =C2=A0I am going to have to see a larger sample siz=
e before I determine if what you have witnessed is in fact a form or not. =
=C2=A0I cannot accept an image as paranormal without knowing where it sits =
among the bulk of audio files. =C2=A0If every file has multiple faces, the =
I would have =C2=A0to say that there is nothing there. 


So, I will certai=
nly keep testing with my copy and hopefully something will really pop for m=
e. =C2=A0I have run through about ten files (EVP and GBC) so far for intens=
ive study and I still haven't got anything that I would consider a positive=
 hit. =C2=A0I need an actual formed face, not portions thereof, to consider=
 an image real. =C2=A0This is the only way to discount visual matrixing.


=
I have high hopes for this though!


Tim

l.net> wrote:


=C2=A0 



I've seen live webcast of ITC sessions where GB =
output is fed directly into the mic line in on a computer running Adobe Aud=
ition with the spectragraph running. It was really compelling to see letter=
s and numbers, not images or pictures, but partial words appear in the grap=
h. At first it was I thought it was a software glitch but it is a repeatabl=
e event. It was on LiveSciFi which is run by Tim Wood, he also thought ther=
e was some kind of code error but it happened on more than one webcast. 

S=
o if anyone has Audition, just feed Box output right in your computer and s=
ee what happens. I wanted to try it tonight but I have Audacity and the spe=
ctragraph feature doesn't have that shaded appearance that Audition does so=
 it's not able to render images or characters, at least as far as I see usi=
ng the various settings.

<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>The whole point of my post, h=
ad you read it with a clear head.  It was all about my own edification=
, that I, and I alone, need to keep plugging in files before I, and I alone=
, make a judgement about MY images and whether they are real or not based u=
pon the images they provide in contrast to the bulk of other files.  I=
f you simply compare your one image with the many circles to the youtube fi=
le, I suspect I am correct in saying that faces occur with much more rarity=
 than your circle file and that they can appear fully formed.  Once ag=
ain, I suspect, only, and I will only be able to tell after time.  Sam=
ple size is everything, and I thought I made that abundantly clear.  T=
he post was simply about my process of learning rather than running out and=
 saying look what I found when I simply don't know what has been found yet =
because it is the first time I have played with the controls rather than se=
eing the end snapshots on another
 persons website.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR><=
/DIV>

ight, Ursula, and not every bridge has to be burned so thoroughly to the gr=

his time thinking a little more clearly about what is written on the page a=
nd not your own emotional backlash construing things in the posted text tha=
t are simply not there.  Had you done this, you would have seen the po=
int of my post was not an attack on you, in ANY way.    </DIV>

V>
<DIV>No, I don't think I am being too critical, but I may have expectati=
ons that are a little too high.  I want to take my time with this. &nb=
sp;For my own understanding, I need to have a large sample size so I know n=
ot only what to expect to see, but what to look for.  I have seen ITC =
snapshots from programs like this that offer full faces.  I would be m=
ore inclined to believe in such an image as opposed to, lets say. two dark =
lines that may or may not be eyebrows. 
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Even in your e=
xample of the towel, you get half a face.  If you have half a face (on=
 the vertical plane, not the horizontal) you can extrapolate out what the e=
ntire face would look like.  This is something I would like to get mys=
elf and I would consider that evidence if it showed up in one of these prog=
rams.  But, if you have something that looks like a forehead and that =
is all there is, then it could also look like a rock or some other such obj=
ect.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I am certainly hoping for results worked in=
to box sessions.  Directing a session with intent, like saying "I am g=
oing to examine the sound waves of this communication in hopes of seeing yo=
ur face.  Is it possible you can show your face to me now through soun=
d? " is what I am after.  If a positive hit like this happens, then I =
will be jumping for joy.  Another good example would be a name, lets s=
ay Tom, that occurs.  If you get a positive affirmation that the name =
you heard is present, then you try the same technique only you address Tom =
by name and get a face, that would be even better.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<D=
IV>But, as it stands now, the faces as they appear are random at best. &nbs=
p;I would be more inclined to believe that when these faces do occur , they=
 are going to occur with a lesser frequency than multiple images in a few s=
econds of audio like Ursula's example.  If this where the case, there =
would be dozens, and possibly hundreds, of faces during a ten minute sessio=
n and I just don't think that is possible.  This is why I need to look=
 at several samples to find out if this is the case or not.  If these =
partialized faces occur in multiples all the time, I would be more apt to d=
iscount it.  But, if they are a rarity affixed to only a few clips out=
 of dozens, I would be more inclined to believe in them.  Sample size =
is everything.  It is like listening to GBC.  If you have never d=
one a session before, you would be inclined to believe every stray radio si=
gnal is a communication.  Only by continued practice
 (expanding your =
sample size) can you start to rule out stray radio with any degree of accur=
acy.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>On the other hand, I am very new to =
this and I could certainly be wrong.  I will continue to plug sound in=
to the programs and hope for the best.  </DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>I =
really want this to work.  As you have probably experienced, when they=
 want you to hear something or know something, they make it very obvious wh=
ile communicating.  I am hoping they apply this same rigor to this new=
 format to show us that they are there.  If they can, then the world o=
f video and audio ITC will merge in one source and then the skeptics be dam=
ned!</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV>Tim<BR><BR>

ind of code error but it happened on more than one webcast. <BR><BR>So if a=
nyone has Audition, just feed Box output right in your computer and see wha=
